nodes.title: Cyprus Kotlin User Group meetup
nodes.body:
### Event Description

KUG Cyprus is for everyone who is interested in Kotlin. Doesn't matter whether you're a beginner or an expert, more into Android or Backend - we all want to learn more about Kotlin and have some fun together!

[Registration form](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cyprus-kotlin-user-group-meetup-2012-tickets-478030140017?)

Agenda
18:00 - 18:30 - Gathering & Intro
18:30 - 19:15 - "Functional programming in Kotlin with Arrow"
Artemiy Mikhaylov (Android developer, inDrive)
In this talk, I will show some popular functional programming usage examples in Java and Kotlin and how the Arrow library can help you to use functional programming more efficiently.
19:15 - 21:00 - Networking
Special Guest - [Katerina Petrova](https://github.com/KaterinaPetrova) (Product Marketing Manager, ex-Developer Advocate for Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile, JetBrains). If you have questions about Kotlin Multiplatform or Kotlin in general, you will have the opportunity to discuss them with Katerina in an informal way.

### Location

Crowne Plaza, Limassol

### Date

20.12.2022

### Time

18.00

### Duration

3h

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://berlincodeofconduct.org)

19:15 - 21:00 - Networking

Location

Crowne Plaza, Limassol

18.00

nodes.title: Wrike Product Management Meetup
nodes.body:
### Event Description

We continue growing [Wrike TechClub](https://www.wrike.com/techclub/) CY  community and happy to announce the event on Product Development challenges! Happy to see you there.

**Venue:** Wrike Office in Nicosia
**Entrance:** Free
**Drinks and Food:** Free
**Language:** English (at least for the talks)
**Registration:** https://pmcy-1.eventbrite.com/

Speakers and Talks:

[Anastasia Shevchenko](https://www.linkedin.com/in/anastasia--shevchenko/), Wrike –  Product research mistake cases
As a PM I do a lot of different researches. As an ever-learning PM, I’ve done a lot of mistakes in such researches.
Let me share 3 cases from my personal experience of things to avoid when doing research, and tips on how I keep myself from repeating them. They are universal, so even though I’ll be using my own examples, I hope you can apply them to your ongoing research as soon as you get home.
[Artyom Sarkisov](https://www.linkedin.com/in/artemsarkisov/), JetBrains – Topic to be announced

Follow us: www.wrike.com/techclub

### Location

wrike-hq-nicosia

### Date

15.12.2022

### Time

18.30

### Duration

2h

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://berlincodeofconduct.org)
nodes.bodyHTML:

As a PM I do a lot of different researches. As an ever-learning PM, I’ve done a lot of mistakes in such researches.
Let me share 3 cases from my personal experience of things to avoid when doing research, and tips on how I keep myself from repeating them. They are universal, so even though I’ll be using my own examples, I hope you can apply them to your ongoing research as soon as you get home.
Artyom Sarkisov, JetBrains – Topic to be announced

Follow us: www.wrike.com/techclub

nodes.title: CocoaHeads Cyprus iOS Talks
nodes.body:
### Event Description

We are happy to announce the first meetup of CocoaHeads Cyprus! Let's gather and get to know each other.

Agenda
18:00 - 18:30 - Gathering & Intro
18:30 - 19:15 - "Swift: some and any. What’s this all about?"
Anton Goncharov (iOS developer, inDrive)
“some” and “any” keywords were introduced in Swift 5 some time ago. The latest Swift 5.7 realease includes a lot of related novelties that significantly change the syntax of protocols and generics. In this talk, we will find out the reasons for the appearance of those changes and figure out how and when to use them properly.
19:15 - 21:00 - Networking

### Location

Crowne Plaza Limassol

### Date

15.12.2022

### Time

18:00

### Duration

3h

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://berlincodeofconduct.org)

### Event Description

BeerJS in Limassol! Let's meet and talk stuff and have fun!

**note on drinking and js**

BeerJS is about creating social spaces to strengthen software communities. There is no requirement to drink to participate, nor talk specifically js (I personally can support conversation on variety of topics and I would love to listen to people talking about it)

nodes.title: A practical introduction to Test Driven Development (TDD) by Marios Georgiou
nodes.body:
### Event Description

GDG is happy to host Marios Georgiou!

In this talk, Marios will walk us through the steps of creating automated unit tests that run every time we build our code, and cover all the basic concepts of unit testing, code coverage and some best practices by showing examples in an interactive, workshop like experience.

This course is targeted to beginners or to more experience developers who want to learn more about TDD.

The examples will use very simple code written in React, however the concepts and practices are similarly applicable on most programming languages, e.g. Java, Python etc.

This is a hybrid event. The physical event will take place at University of Cyprus (Nicosia), in the department of Computer Science building THEE 01, Room B101 (Basement, Walk-in Lab). map: https://goo.gl/maps/BoDyu6fmyNPaYkwC6

The virtual event will be on zoom (see below) and also on CDC discord channel. Visit https://cdc.cy to access the discord channel and view the events channel for details on how to access.

For the participants of the physical event, pizza and refreshments will be offered by our sponsor "TSYS A Global Payments Company".

For RSVP, kindly visit https://gdg.community.dev/j/wt7w56qhpa29j/

Looking forward to see you there!

Don't forget to like our FB page at https://www.facebook.com/GDGCyprus and also checkout http://cdc.cy, the Cyprus Developer Community portal.

Like/Share :)

Zoom:
https://us06web.zoom.us/j/81182498281?pwd=RTdwakZ5ZklvdG8xOW5ESzdjSElKQT09

Meeting ID: 811 8249 8281
Passcode: 576202

### Location

Nicosia at University Of Cyprus / Virtual on zoom and discord

### Date

17.05.2022

### Time

19.00

### Duration

1h30m

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://berlincodeofconduct.org)

GDG is happy to host Marios Georgiou!

In this talk, Marios will walk us through the steps of creating automated unit tests that run every time we build our code, and cover all the basic concepts of unit testing, code coverage and some best practices by showing examples in an interactive, workshop like experience.

This course is targeted to beginners or to more experience developers who want to learn more about TDD.

The examples will use very simple code written in React, however the concepts and practices are similarly applicable on most programming languages, e.g. Java, Python etc.

This is a hybrid event. The physical event will take place at University of Cyprus (Nicosia), in the department of Computer Science building THEE 01, Room B101 (Basement, Walk-in Lab). map: https://goo.gl/maps/BoDyu6fmyNPaYkwC6

The virtual event will be on zoom (see below) and also on CDC discord channel. Visit https://cdc.cy to access the discord channel and view the events channel for details on how to access.

For the participants of the physical event, pizza and refreshments will be offered by our sponsor "TSYS A Global Payments Company".

For RSVP, kindly visit https://gdg.community.dev/j/wt7w56qhpa29j/

Looking forward to see you there!

Don't forget to like our FB page at https://www.facebook.com/GDGCyprus and also checkout http://cdc.cy, the Cyprus Developer Community portal.
